required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Outcomes Study of Late Effects After Proton RT for Pediatric Tumors of the Brain, Head, and Neck
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of Late Effects After Proton Radiotherapy for Pediatric Tumors of the Brain, Head, and Neck

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to collect information from medical records to see what effects proton beam radiation has on cancer and analyze possible side effects.

detailed_description.textblock: Data collection will be obtained from the patient's medical records including initial evaluation, radiotherapy completion records and follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: Measure late effects of proton therapy on pediatric patients with CNS tumors

secondary_outcome.measure: Survival endpoints of local control, progression-free survival, and overall and cause-specific survival.

study_pop.textblock: Patients treated at a radiation oncology clinic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Estimated >5 cc of the brain tissue to receive >5 CGE radiation
- Patient must be less than 21 years of age at time of consent.
- Patients that require localized and craniospinal irradiation.
- Patients and/or patient parent must complete baseline Quality of Life Questionnaire as applicable by patient age group.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior radiation therapy.
- Evidence of metastases outside the central nervous system.

overall_official.affiliation: University of Florida Proton Therapy Institute

facility.name: University of Florida Proton Therapy Institute

link.description: Contact the University of Florida Proton Therapy Institute
